quantityRules.description: Single gecko requires 20 gallons vertical (18Ã—18Ã—24 inches). Each additional female requires 10 more gallons. Never house males together.

setupTips: Prioritize vertical space - height more important than floor space
Provide lots of branches and cork bark for climbing
Use vertical plants (real or fake) for cover and humidity
notes: Nocturnal and arboreal - active at night, lives in trees
Very docile and easy to handle
Can drop tail when stressed - will NOT regrow
Unique diet - can thrive on commercial crested gecko diet (CGD)

warnings.message: Never grab by tail - they will drop it and it will NOT grow back
Room temperature (72-78Â°F) is ideal - do NOT use heat lamps. Temperatures above 80Â°F can be fatal.

feedingRequirements: Omnivorous - primary diet is commercial crested gecko diet (CGD)
Supplement with insects 2-3x weekly (crickets, dubia roaches)
feedingSchedule: Juveniles (0-12 months): CGD nightly, insects 3x weekly
Sub-adults (1-2 years): CGD every other night, insects 2x weekly
Adults (2+ years): CGD 3x weekly, insects 1-2x weekly
waterNotes: Provide water dish but they prefer licking droplets from leaves
Mist enclosure in evening to provide drinking water
mistingNotes: Mist heavily every evening - crested geckos drink from droplets
Maintain 50-70% humidity, increase to 70-80% during shedding
Allow enclosure to dry out during the day before evening misting
